content: Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 06 Sep 2019Any suggestions if I should pursue IT, Engineering, Business or Accounting?I'm thinking of getting a degree but with my grades and all, I'm guessing I can only get into private.Looking to earn big stable bucks if I work hard and  get promoted lol and most important job security1 answerAnswerBump0

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 07 Sep 2019The character to thrive in IT, Engineer, Business or Accounting are actually quite different.Accounting is a stable field, but you need to be meticulously detailed and.. well it's boring.Engineering- you need to take care of details too... and able to think in different layers and dimension.Business-  not sure if you mean running a business later with your degree.. need to be an all-rounder, need to handle stress and excitementIT - technical stuff and jargons. Totally different from accounting or business0 comments0
